ratings.comment: Rosenmeyer is a gem of the classics department. Probably my favorite professor I've ever had. She is so accessible outside of class and prioritizes students engaging with the material over constant assessment. She knows her stuff and thoroughly answered everything that I and my classmates were curious about. Take a class with her!!!

Prof. Rosenmeyer was amazing! She went above and beyond to explain concepts in lecture and made study guides for all the tests. Class was an easy A if you put any effort in. Lectures basically just clarify the readings and there's no attendance. 2 midterms and a take-home final. Would recommend for an easy literature credit.

She was a very good lecturer and really tried to make them interesting. She likes to have audience participation but it is not required in lecture. There were two midterms, but she wrote them so that the students who read the material and paid attention in class would succeed easily.

She was solid overall, lectures were mostly clarifying the reading or explaining visual art.. so if you're understanding the reading and have background in art, i am not sure if the lectures are necessary.
She's great.  Really responsive to how the class feels about pacing.

Super easy! Grades kind of depend on TA but the readings are straight forward and if you half pay attention in class, you'll get an A. Powerpoints are interesting & she's very clear! Definitely take this for an easy credit
Rosenmeyer is great! I came in loving English and classical history and her class was my favorite that semester. She does everything she can to make the class fun and interesting.

Prof. R is a fine lecturer. I cannot recall a day of lecture that I deemed boring or lacking purpose. She always has interesting points to make. Her tests are not incredibly difficult. In fact, she has professed to me personally that she hopes they are easy for those who pay attention and read. Very approachable; has given me solid scheduling help.

I really liked this class. Rosenmeyer knows her stuff and you can tell she likes teaching it. She makes very helpful review sheets that cover everything that will show up on the midterms, and the final was just prepared essays and some easy slide IDs. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who needs an easy and interesting lit credit!

Do the reading and pay attention in section and you should be fine. Study guides are helpful for the exam. Just give as much information possible on the exams and you'll be fine. She likes to engage her audience a lot and ask questions. Attendance isn't necessary, but may make picture IDs a little hard on the exams.
Awesome professor. Really cares about her students and goes over really interesting material. Highly recommended!
not too hard as long as you pay attention and attend every day. asked students to babysit her kids tho - not so classy.... likable and sense of humor.
Very passionate about the material and enjoyable to hear here take on ancient culture.  At times a bit dull, but to be expected with such historical material.  Very, very nice.
Very helpful - she helped get me to pass this class. She is very clear in a class that might have otherwise caused me to hate school. Fun to listen to.
